description: Ghostscript rasterizing failed - and a search of that error just shows multiple forums in which the guy who created the program refuses to deal with the error

Doesn't come with a man page. The docs linked in the Github page say I can do `ocrmypdf --help`, but this doesn't work. So I tried just using the docs, I tried `ocrmypdf --output-type pdf input.pdf output.pdf`, it did nothing. It seems like anything you try it will just say "Illegal instruction" & do nothing.
OCRmyPDF is on the level of professional OCR Software. Love it!
"An exception occurred while executing the pipeline"

Quickly did the job.
You may need to install tesseract as well.
Documentation available at https://ocrmypdf.readthedocs.io/en/latest/
summary: Good CLI tool to perform OCR

description: Install. uninstalled, and reinstalled it. Still missing the app icon. So, the program is worthless if you can load it after it stalling it. So, I give it a one star not because I hate it but because I did get to try it.

The APT version doesn't have jbig2enc for lossless data. I compiled that from source, and still the command line refuses to recognize my preferred output type.

Then I installed the SNAP version and Ghostscript is broken this time. I'm going to try the PIP version next.
summary: DO NOT USE THE SNAP STORE THERE IS ONLY GARBAGE HERE

description: Fonctionne très mal sur Ubuntu 18.04.6 LTS. Laisse un écran noir et oblige au reboot.
